alert.note: Alert for Rutherford; Smith; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:15PM CDT until July 18 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN SMITH...DE KALB...SOUTHEASTERN RUTHERFORD...CENTRAL COFFEE...VAN BUREN...WARREN...SOUTHEASTERN WILSON...NORTHWESTERN GRUNDY...WHITE...PUTNAM AND CANNON COUNTIES... At 515 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Gordonsville to 7 miles north of Woodbury to 12 miles southeast of Murfreesboro, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Cookeville, McMinnville, Manchester, Sparta, Smithville, Woodbury, Spencer, Algood, Monterey, Gruetli-Laager, Watertown, Baxter, Gordonsville, Hickman, South Carthage, Altamont, Alexandria, Coalmont and Morrison. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 247 and 305. Interstate 24 between mile markers 81 and 113. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
